intro: Actephila platysepala, commonly known as the broad-sepaled actephila, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with showy, often pink or white petals. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape, with smooth or slightly hairy surfaces. Actephila platysepala thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
